sen.j: 平城（ひらじろ）は、平地に築かれた城をいう。
sen.e: A Hira-jiro castle indicates a castle built on flat land.
A Hira-jiro castle indicates a castle built on flat land.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: A Hira-jiro castle indicates a castle built on flat land.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 江戸時代の軍学者により分類された地勢による城郭分類法の一つである。
sen.e: It is a category of castles classified by military scolars in the Edo period, based on their geographical features.
It is a category of castles classified by military scholars in the Edo period, based on their geographical features.
sen.cmt: spelling
sen.e: It is a castle category based on geographical features that was classified by military scholars in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに従い修正

sen.j: 戦国時代 (日本)以前は山城が中心であり、平城はほとんど築かれなかった。
sen.e: In and before the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) (in Japan), castles were mostly yama-shiro castles built mostly on a mountain, being scarecely built on flat land.
In and before the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States in Japan), castles were mostly yama-shiro castles that were built on mountains, with scarce few built on flat land.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: Before and during the Sengoku period (Period of Warring States in Japan), most castles were built on mountains (these were known as Yama-shiro castles); very few were built on flat land.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに従い修正

sen.j: しかし地形的にどうしても適当な山がなく、平地に城を築く場合もあった。
sen.e: However, when no mountain suitable to buid a castle on was availabe geographically by any means, the castle was sometimes built on flat land.
However, when no suitable mountains were available on which to build a castle, the castle was built on flat land.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: However, if no suitable mountain could be found to build a castle on, one was built on flat land.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに従い修正

sen.j: その場合は河川を防衛線として利用したり、土塁・堀を築いて防御とした。
sen.e: In that case, a river or rivers were used as a defense line or lines to protect the castle, or mounds and/or walls were built for its protection.
In that case, a river or rivers were used as a defense line to protect the castle, with mounds and walls built for its protection.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: In such cases, one or more rivers were used as a line of defense for the castle, with mounds and walls built for its protection.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに従い修正

sen.j: 代表的な近世の平城の例では、名古屋城、駿府城、二条城、広島城などがある。
sen.e: Nagoya-jo Castle, Sunppu-jo Castel, Ni-jo Castle and Hiroshima-jo Castel are typical Hira-jiro castle examples in the early-modern times.
Nagoya-jo Castle, Sunpu-jo Castel, Ni-jo Castle and Hiroshima-jo Castles are typical examples of Hira-jiro castle in early-modern times.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: Nagoya-jo Castle, Sunpu-jo Castel, Ni-jo Castle and Hiroshima-jo Castles are typical examples of Hira-jiro castle in early-modern times.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 平城として見られることがある江戸城や大坂城の分類は平山城とすることがある。
sen.e: Edo-jo Castel and Osaka-jo Castle that are sometimes considered as Hira-jiro Castles are also sometimes classified into the Hirayama-jiro Castle (castles built on a hill in a plain).
Edo-jo Castle and Osaka-jo Castle are sometimes considered as Hira-jiro Castles, and are also sometimes classified into the Hirayama-jiro Castle (castles built on a hill in a plain).
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: Although Edo-jo Castle and Osaka-jo Castle are sometimes considered Hira-jiro castles, they are sometimes classified as Hirayama-jiro castles (those built on a hill in a plain).
sen.cmt: フィードバックに従い修正

sen.j: また水城としては、高松城 (讃岐国)、今治城、中津城（以上、日本三大一覧城）、高島城、膳所城などがある。
sen.e: Mizu-shiro (castles on lakes or marshes for defensive reasons) includes Takamatsu-jo Castle (in the Sanuki province), Imabari-jo Castle and Naktsu-jo Castle, all of which are listed for the castle item in "a list of the three typical castles, mountains, etc. in Japan"), Takashima-jo Castle and Zeze-jo Castle.

Mizu-shiro (castles on lakes or marshes for defensive reasons) include Takamatsu-jo Castle (in Sanuki province), Imabari-jo Castle and Nakatsu-jo Castle (all of which are listed as castles in the list of the three typical castles, mountains, etc. in Japan), Takashima-jo Castle and Zeze-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: Examples of Mizu-shiro (castles built on lakes or marshes for defensive reasons) include Takamatsu-jo Castle (in Sanuki province), Imabari-jo Castle, Nakatsu-jo Castle, Takashima-jo Castle, and Zeze-jo Castle (the first three examples given here all appear in the list of the top three castles in Japan).
sen.cmt: フィードバックに従い修正

sen.j: 平城は、平地に土塁と堀で囲った鎌倉時代初期から南北朝時代 (日本)にかけての武士の住まいである「方形館（ほうけいやかた）」、後の室町・戦国時代にかけての守護の居館である守護所などの「館・舘（たて）」がもととなった。
sen.e: Hira-jiro castles were based on 館・舘 (both pronounced as "tate" and indicating a building): one of such "tate" was 方形館 (houkei-yakata buildings), which were built on flat land surrounded by mounds and walls and were samurai residences in the early Kamakura period and in the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties, and the other of such tate were shugosho (provincial administration), which were 居館 (residences) of shugo in the later eras of the Muromachi period and the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States)..

Hira-jiro castles were based on 館・舘 (both pronounced as ta-te and indicate a building): one such ta-te was 方形館 (houkei-yakata buildings), which were built on flat land surrounded by mounds and walls and were samurai residences in the early Kamakura period and in the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties. Another such ta-te was the shugosho (provincial administration), which were 居館 (residences) of shugo in the later days of the Muromachi period and the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).
sen.cmt: Wording; I don't understand why the translator has left the kanji in this passage. There is no reason to keep the kanji.
sen.e: Hira-jiro castles were based on the following two types of buildings: Hokei-yakata buildings, which were samurai residences built in the early Kamakura period and the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) on flat land surrounded by mounds and walls; and Ta-te buildings, such as the Shugosho (provincial administration offices) where shugo (military governors) lived in the later days of the Muromachi period and the Sengoku period.
sen.cmt: 「平城のもとになったのは方形館と館・舘である」と訳を修正し、漢字および「(Period of Warring States)」を削除しました（既出のため）。日本の「南北朝時代」を「the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan)」で統一しました。フィードバックに従い修正

sen.j: 守護所は、室町幕府の御所を模して建てられ、また山城を詰城（つめのしろ）としていることが多い。
sen.e: Shugosho was built imitating a mansion in the Muromachi bakufu,.and yama-shiro castles were mostly used as a tsume-shiro castle (the last castle to be kept).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shugosho was built to imitate a mansion in the Muromachi bakufu. Yama-shiro castles were mostly used as a tsume-shiro castle (the last castle to be maintained).
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: Shugosho were built to imitate the gosho (residence) of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and Yama-shiro castles were mostly used as a tsume—no-shiro castle (a kind of castle of last refuge).
sen.cmt: 「a mansion」矢印「gosho (Imperial Palace)」とし、「(Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun)」を追記、1文にしました。フィードバックに従い修正。

sen.j: 街道や水運の要所などの付近に築いた。
sen.e: Therefore, shugosho was built around a strategic spot along a big road or around a strategic spot in a water transportation system.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, shugosho were built around a strategic spot along a big road or around a strategic spot in a water transportation system.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: Shugosho were built at a strategic spot along a main road or water transportation system.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに従い修正

sen.j: また、地方の在地領主にも普及し同様の形状で築城が行われた。
sen.e: In addition, increasingly more local territory lords became to use it, and castles in the similar styles were built.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, local lords came to use them more frequently, and castles in similar styles were built.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: Local lords came to use shugosho more frequently, and castles were built in a similar style.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに従い修正

sen.j: 室町後期では織田信長が築城した室町第（足利義昭の御所）や二条城などが後の近世平城に影響したと考えられている。
sen.e: It is considered that Muromachi-dai (the mansion of yoshiaki ASIKAGA), which Nobunaga ODA built in the later Mutomachi period, and Ni-jo Castle affected the architecture of hira-jiro castles in the later early modern times.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is considered that Muromachi-dai (the mansion of Yoshiaki ASIKAGA), which Nobunaga ODA built in the late Mutomachi period, and Ni-jo Castle affected the architecture of hira-jiro castles in the later part of early modern times.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: The Muromachi-dai, which Nobunaga ODA built as a residence for Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA in the late Muromachi period, and Ni-jo Castle are believed to have influenced the architecture of Hira-jiro castles in the later part of early modern times.
sen.cmt: スペル修正、「mansion」→「the Imperial Palace」としました。フィードバックに従い修正

sen.j: 近世には、天守が建てられた城もあった。
sen.e: In the early modern times, castles with a tenshu (main tower of a castle) were built.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the early modern times, castles with tenshu (main tower) were built.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: In early modern times, castles with a tenshu (main tower) were built.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに従い修正

sen.j: しかし江戸時代には武家諸法度発布による天守などの無許可造営の禁止、必要ないとのことでの中止、災害による亡失、藩の財政難という経済的な理由等により次第に建築されなくなった。
sen.e: Howerver, gradually, tenshu became not to be built from the following reasons: Building tenshu without permission became to be prohibited due to the enforcement of Buke shohatto (Laws for the Military Houses), building tenshu was also stopped by the reason that it was unnecessary, some tenshu were destroyed due to natural disasters, or tenshu was not built due to financial shortage in domains.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Howerver, tenshu gradually fell out of style due to the following reasons: building tenshu without permission was prohibited due to the enforcement of Buke shohatto (Laws for the Military Houses), building tenshu also became unnecessary, some tenshu were destroyed due to natural disasters, or tenshu were too costly on the treasury of domains.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: However, the building of tenshu gradually became less common for the following reasons: the building of tenshu without permission was prohibited following the enactment of Buke shohatto (Laws for the Military Houses); the building of tenshu became unnecessary; some tenshu were destroyed in natural disasters; and the construction of tenshu put too much of a burden on a domain's finances.
sen.cmt: スペル修正しました。フィードバックに従い修正
